title: Gregor Townsend determined to not allow 'Typhoon Haggis' to distract Scotland in tournament-defining week
text:
Gregor Townsend, the Scotland head coach, is determined not to let his side’s World Cup campaign be blown off course against Russia tomorrow while he keeps one eye on “Typhoon Haggis”.

Townsend has made 14 changes from the side who defeated Samoa 34-0 for the match in Shizuoka before facing a four-day turnaround heading into their final group game against Japan on Sunday. ​

Scotland will need to extract maximum points against Russia to keep the pressure on Japan, who claimed a controversial bonus-point try against Samoa after referee Jaco Peyper penalised a crooked scrum feed.​

The...
description: Gregor Townsend, the Scotland head coach, is determined not to let his side’s World Cup campaign be blown off course against Russia tomorrow while he keeps one eye on “Typhoon Haggis”.
